item.title: Software Developer (Fleet Manager)
item.description:
Description

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors makes material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers include some of the world’s most recognized brands, including GE and Toyota. OTTO Motors is a division of Clearpath Robotics. For more information, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Senior Software Developer to join the team responsible for the design, integration, and evolution of Clearpath\'s fleet management and related system software. Your goal is to help build a system of robust and efficient software that can be deployed or upgraded by hundreds of integrator partners across the globe with the minimum of fuss.

For this role, we are seeking an individual to join the Fleet Core team to help us build industry defining applications and technologies for working with fleets of autonomous vehicles. You will be working closely with other members of the development team as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to ensure the stability and functionality of the fleet management system.

About You

You have produced and shipped reliable software. You want ownership of the software you create and maintain, taking responsibility for the design and quality. You understand architecture and can present technical information clearly to senior leadership.

You have leadership experience through mentoring and/or technical leadership roles. You understand networking, Linux hosted applications and the value of a good development test case. You relish the thought of working on projects that interact with the world, even more so when they can do so on their own. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day.

Requirements:

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic the ability to work remotely is a requirement. 

 

Required Experience/Skills:

  • 5+ years of related Software Development experience
  • Diploma in Computer Software, Computer Science or equivalent
  • Experience working in a multidisciplinary team
  • Strong Python development experience
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • SCM experience (git, Gitlab, Github, Bitbucket, SVN, etc.)
  • Experience with rigorous software testing, and Continuous Integration process and CI systems (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, etc.)
  • Experience with ticket and content management systems (JIRA, Confluence, etc.) 
  • Working in a collaborative environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagrams, discussion, and examples
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures

Bonus points for:

  • Experience with frameworks / platforms utilizing SQL Databases (Django, Flask, etc.)
  • Experience with distributed software systems
  • Familiarity with network analysis / pcap based tools
  • Knowledge of Debian packaging system
  • ROS software development experience

Description

Position: Controller          

Location: Kitchener, Ontario             

Experience: 10+ years of relevant work experience

Division: OTTO Motors

Education: Professional accounting designation (CA/CMA/CGA)

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

As the Controller at Clearpath, you will be responsible for overseeing all accounting activities including accounts receivable and cash receipts, collections, accounts payable, and the month-end accounting close. You will have nearly limitless opportunities to take on a wide range of challenges. We are looking for someone who will not settle for anything short of conquering these challenges while maintaining a high service level to our internal and external clients.

Primary responsibilities:

  • Develop finance strategy to yield more efficient procedures and use of resources while maintaining a high level of accuracy.
  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions
  • Prepare timely and accurate consolidated interim and annual financial statements and reporting packages including providing insights into management discussion and analysis
  • Using professional judgment to assess estimates used in the financial statements
  • Review monthly accounting close process and working papers of the Assistant Controller, including analytical review of the monthly operating results to ensure accurate accounting records are maintained
  • Design, document and implement accounting internal controls, policies and procedures to ensure account accuracy and efficiency
  • Cash management including forecasting cash requirements
  • Monitor debt levels and compliance with debt covenants
  • Act as one of the primary contacts for external financial auditors, including ensuring that information is prepared on a timely basis
  • Comply with local, state, and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings
  • Identify, develop and implement business process changes to ensure the financial processes and reporting meet the needs of the business. This includes changes to business processes and/or optimization of current ERP system or implementation of new ERP system functionality
  • Any other responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Minimum 7+ years of experience, some of which in a manufacturing environment
  • Professional accounting designation (CPA, CA)
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Prior experience working with EPICOR, SQL, BAQ
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external clients
  • Results-oriented and always looking to improve processes
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage competing priorities, and adhere to tight deadlines

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

Position:          Robot Builder (CPR)          

Location:         Waterloo, Ontario              

Experience:    1-3 Years relevant work experience

Education:       Diploma in a related field

Division:          Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in producing our core products as well as aiding in the construction of prototype robots for tests.  Can you get behind that?

You will build all of our robots, starting from bare parts and PCBAs through to drive testing and basic debug. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws or soldering, you will be charged with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Mechanical assembly of robotics platforms using hand tools
  • Cable installation
  • Basic software installation and testing
  • Packaging finished goods

Additional tasks may include:

  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.   

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on product assembly/assembly line
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, electric drill
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and Word.
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines, job responsibilities and the local gravity field

Bonus points for:

  • Ability to diagnose broken robots by their sounds and smells
  • Soldering experience
  • Basic knowledge of programming languages, Python, C, C++, etc.
  • Familiarity with Linux
  • Previous experience using machining tools, in particular a table top milling machine
  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance.
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Content Marketing Coordinator
item.description:
Description

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Opportunity:

OTTO Motors is looking for a Content Marketing Coordinator to join our mighty team. In this role, you’ll help manage OTTO Motors’ content calendar and develop assets at every stage of the buyer journey from thought leadership at TOFU all the way down to technical pieces in BOFU that are intended to educate late-stage prospects, partners and customers. Your main goal will be to support a content plan that will engage and keep prospects converting throughout the funnel.

Reporting to the Manager, Demand Generation and working closely with leaders across the organization, especially the Director of Product Marketing, you’ll play a key role in driving short and long-form content at a time when content is at the center of our new verticalization strategy.

Responsibilities:

  •  Effectively help level up OTTO Motors’ content calendar (blogs, eBooks, one pagers, guides, emails, newsletters, presentations, video scripts and photography).
  • Support OTTO Motors’ content pillars; you should have command of market and industry trends, enjoy being creative and understand how to develop content for all stages of the funnel: top, middle, and bottom.
  • Leverage internal experts on the Product, Engineering and Services teams as well as external subject matter experts, influencers, advisors, and customers to create technical content that is engaging, informative, and useful.
  • Repurpose content in multiple formats, including webpages, blogs, and videos in partnership with other members of the marketing team.
  • Ensure all content aligns with the FY23 content calendar and content pillars
  • Liaise with external vendors to complete content pieces (graphic designers, content vendors)

What You Bring to the Role:

  • BSc/BA or diploma in marketing, communications, or equivalent
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills
  • Passionate about writing and creating content in many forms 
  • Keen on tracking engagement and conversion metrics to understand how the content resonates with the intended audience
  • Self-starter who is curious enough about our market and prospects and wants to figure out which content is most valuable to them
  • Confidence in your own writing and editing
  • Well-organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high change environment
What\'s In It for you?
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexibility in location (hybrid or remote work across Ontario)
  • Flexibility in hours (core hours 10am-3pm EST)
  • Comprehensive benefits, including wellness days
  • Perks to help set home office
  • Opportunity to make a difference in the supply chain!
  • Fun and friendly co-workers :) 

At OTTO we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Marketing Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position: Marketing Specialist
Location: Waterloo, Ontario
Education: BSc/BA or diploma in Marketing, Communications, or equivalent 
Division: Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job:

Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Marketing Specialist supports the development and implementation of the content, social and event marketing strategies.  Through creative storytelling and other methods, you will develop, publish, disseminate compelling and engaging communications and marketing content, ensuring alignment to Clearpath brand and purpose and supporting corporate strategy and marketing objectives.  You will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of Clearpath social media channels, community growth and brand engagement, social media monitoring, measurement and reporting, content research and development, writing and design for social media.  Finally, you will play a supportive role in planning, managing and executing marketing events including robotics conferences and tradeshows, and other marketing related activities as required. 

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop, optimize and publish engaging content to support lead generation and nurturing  (e.g., customer stories, robot spotlights, event recaps, announcements, video scripts,  etc) 
  • Ensure all content aligns with brand voice, tone, and editorial guidelines.
  • Generate, edit, publish and share daily content (original text, images, video) on company social media channels that builds meaningful connections and encourages engagement
  • Moderate all user-generated content in line with the moderation policy for each community
  • Create and manage editorial content calendar and syndication schedules 
  • Support and assist with event planning, administrative, and logistics duties for key robotics conferences and tradeshows
  • Assist in designing and creating emails, including the Clearpath monthly newsletter, landing pages and other marketing materials
  • Assist in adding, modifying and administering products on the Clearpath store using the Shopify ecommerce platform.

Skills and Experience:

  • BA in Communications, Marketing, Business, New Media or Public Relations
  • Strong understanding of inbound marketing strategy and search engine optimization (SEO)
  • Proven working experience in content and social media marketing 
  • Strong writing and editing chops, with a talent for distilling complex ideas into plain language. Whether writing long-form guides or micro-copy, you work hard to make every word matter—even under a tight deadline.
  • Demonstrable social networking experience and social analytics tools knowledge
  • Knowledge of online marketing and good understanding of major marketing channels, web development and design, email marketing and marketing system administration.
  • Detail oriented with ability to accurately and efficiently proofread all communications for accuracy and brand compliance
  • Well-organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, unpredictable environments
  • Able to coordinate and work effectively across many teams 
  • Fluency in English

Bonus:

  • Experience in a marketing role is preferred. Bonus if you’ve worked at a technology company. You have a track record for producing content that moves the needle. 
  • Experience with basic photo and video editing using Adobe Photoshop, Premiere or Canva
  • Experience with web tools including Pardot, Hootsuite, Wordpress, Social Media platforms.
  • A passion for learning about your audience (robotics researchers and developers) and how Clearpath’s  products fulfill their needs—as well as a genuine interest in the robotics space. 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863

item.title: Applications Engineer (Clearpath Robotics)
item.description:
Description

Position:       Applications Designer (Clearpath Robotics)
Location:      Waterloo, Ontario    
Experience:   2-5 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:    Undergraduate Degree in Engineering 
Division:       Clearpath Robotics

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

We offer a wide range of consulting, design, prototyping, manufacturing, integration, and support services enabling our clients to prototype state of the art applications in mobile robotics in their industry or field of research.We are seeking a Mobile Robotics Applications Designer to be constantly learning new technology, developing new system concepts, creating the foundation for successful projects, and helping our clients get started with their new robot and software tools.

You will undertake a wide variety of tasks in various aspects of mechanical, electrical, mechatronics, and software engineering and product development, primarily in early-stage design, development, requirements and specification definition, cost estimating as well as ongoing support for the Clearpath project teams. This will range from answering early-stage technical questions in collaboration with our sales team to technology investigations, system architecting, developing concepts for integrated multi-robot systems, drafting product requirements and functional specification documents for new products, to presenting concepts and proposals to potential customers.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Project scope definition in collaboration with our sales team and prospective clients
  • Becoming a product expert on Clearpath’s mobile robot platforms and the sensors, software and equipment we integrate
  • Concept development, cost modeling, risk assessments, and proposal writing
  • Providing support to our sales team on calls and meetings with potential clients, including some travel to customer sites for discovery and presentation of proposals
  • Sourcing major components from existing and new suppliers
  • Interacting and coordinating our development team as necessary to come up with new ideas
  • Interacting with our project management team to develop project execution plans and schedules
  • Providing guidance as necessary to the project team after design begins

Additional tasks may include:

  • Evaluation of new products and vendors
  • Developing demos with our products and assisting Sales & Marketing in demonstrating Clearpath\'s products and capabilities
  • Investigating new technologies and markets
  • Presenting at tradeshows and seminars
  • Developing early-stage prototypes and proof of concepts for new products and
  • Testing new products

About You

You want to work for a technology company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You like being the go-to person for technical questions. If you see something new, you have to understand how it works and try it for yourself. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Degree in engineering or a related field, with applicable background
  • Working knowledge in software, controls, mobile robotics, and/or manufacturing processes
  • Experience in pitching a value proposition for a new technology
  • Able to quickly grasp new technical and business problems, able to put self in clients\' shoes
  • Capable of identifying skills and resources required to complete projects which may range from 3-18 months in duration
  • Able to communicate concepts readily through sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to facilitate productive technical team meetings to converge on solution definitions and work plans

Bonus points for:

  • Understanding of the various problems which face robotics adopters (technical and otherwise)
  • Proficiency in using 3D solid modeling for generating concept models
  • Past hands-on experience with mobile robots (hardware and/or software, both is ideal)
  • Project management experience
  • Vehicle design experience
  • Comfortable presenting to small groups wearing expensive suits
  • Past experience participating in development projects that have gone terribly wrong
  • Past experience in "traditional" application engineering and systems commissioning
  • Identifying the grammar mistakes in this job description
  • Ability to diagnose broken equipment by its sounds and smells, or while blindfolded

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Project Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:        Project Manager           
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario              
Experience:   5+ Years of relevant work experience
Education:     Undergraduate degree or college diploma in an Engineering discipline
Division:         OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are shipping more and more robots and are taking on bigger contracts. We need an additional Project Manager to join our Program Management Office team to take our projects from original concept through to final implementation.

As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating project deliverables and serving as the point of contact between customers and other departments. As the embodiment of the customer, your job is to lead the project and its internal team through the life of each project with regard to the budget, schedule, customer satisfaction and closeout procedures, from purchase order acceptance to customer acceptance. Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Lead and oversee the internal project team and complete projects efficiently, according to schedules, budgets and consistent with company and department processes and standards.
  • Primary contact for both internal and external customers.
  • Work with the Professional Services and PMO department to develop, review and implement continuous improvement methods and procedures.
  • Managing all project risks.
  • Assisting with and attending pre-order customer meetings, as requested.
  • Ensure sufficient and requisite resources are assigned to all project tasks, and elevating requests to department managers as necessary.
  • Ensure that all project problems are properly identified, assigned and addressed, using appropriate ticketing scheme, and that all issue tickets are managed and completed as efficiently as possible.
  • Holding regular team communications, with the internal team, external channel partners and customers, creating and distributing minutes and action lists.
  • Advocates and fosters a team environment within the PMO, Professional Services and the company as a whole.
  • Responsible for achieving and maintaining customer satisfaction.
  • Direct customer to the appropriate Sales and Application Engineering contacts when provided with expansion opportunities.
  • Accountable for all aspects of project reporting including financial reports (EACs, budget reconciliation) regular KPR and department management progress reporting.
  • Track all contract changes with written Change Order Requests, maintaining appropriate documentation and financial impacts.
  • Ensure received purchase orders match internal CRM and ERP inputs and correct using necessary channels, and verify product lead time and inventory availability.
  • Participate in initial schedule building planning meetings, and manage the facilitation of project schedule, ensuring project milestones and phases are adhered to, taking corrective actions as necessary when delays are encountered both internally and externally.

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are customer-focused. You view work as more than just a job and are never satisfied with a project left incomplete. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You have a mixture of education and experience that makes you a methodical, organized, and technically-minded asset to our team. You can work independently to get the job done but you also know when to escalate so small problems stay that way.

As our next Project Manager, you know how to manage not just the customer, but your own time. You have proven project management experience from previous roles and intimately understand the project lifecycle. Bonus points for managing engineering related projects. You are not above accepting or giving help when help is needed.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Bachelors’ degree in business administration, operations, or education in project management an asset.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Project is a must.
  • Thorough understanding of project lifecycle/stages.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication.
  • 5+ years of external customer project management experience.
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks at once, while still paying attention to detail.
  • Proficient in Microsoft and Google document platforms.
  • A strong work ethic and self-starter attitude who learns quickly, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Bonus Points For:

  • Mechatronics background
  • PMP or working towards PMP designation
  • JIRA, Salesforce and Epicor knowledge and experience
  • Earned Value understanding/experience

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior IT Solutions Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position: Senior IT Solutions Specialist

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 5+ Years relevant experience

Education: Bachelor\'s Degree

Division: OTTO Motors

About us

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

In this role, you will be responsible for owning, maintaining and providing integration of the AMR/Fleet Management products within enterprise IT environments. This role touches on architecture design, providing best practices, and in some instances being able to troubleshoot and diagnose problems with robot deployments both at the networking and infrastructure layers.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Customer-facing experience in pre-sales, implementation and support
  • Development of SOWs relating to VLAN segmentation, networking, wireless coverage requirements and MES/WRP system integration
  • Creation of documentation on how our products integrate within customers’ environments
  • Managing tier 3 escalations from the implementation and support teams

Required Skills:

  • 5 years of strong IT network design and troubleshooting experience.
  • Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
  • Proficient understanding of the OSI layer, TCP/IP protocols and their use-cases.
  • Proficient in managing and troubleshooting VPN Clients and Protocols (Tinc, OpenVPN, Cisco, etc.)
  • Proficient in navigating IT interoperability issues and driving them to resolution.
  • Proficient in delivering network topology and server architecture topics to various audiences.
  • Must be proficient with Linux and the Linux networking stack.
  • Experience in developing and recommending good enterprise infrastructure design.
  • Experience with virtual infrastructure such as VMware vSphere technologies.
  • Experience with the 802.11 wireless standards by describing best practices and diagnosing/triaging issues.
  • Knowledge of Information Security best practices
  • Certifications in CompTIA Security+, CompTIA Network+ and CISSP
  • Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure.
  • Experience with Hypervisor

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun
  • Engineering run quarterly Hack Days to pursue interests, passion projects, and experiments
  • Enjoy designing the future of robotics!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics atwww.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

Clearpath\'s custom solutions and services group offers our clients access to our ‘skunkworks’ teams, that specialize in unmanned vehicles and mobile robotics technology development and integration, thereby providing them a shorter time to market at lower risk and lower total cost. We offer a wide range of consulting, design, prototyping, manufacturing, integration, and support services enabling our clients to stay focused on their core value in their respective markets without having to worry about the technical details of the automation technology that enables their products. We are seeking a senior level Mobile Robotics Applications Engineer to be constantly learning new technology, developing new system concepts, creating the foundation for successful projects, and helping our clients get started with their new robot and software tools.

You will undertake a wide variety of tasks in various aspects of mechanical, electrical, mechatronics, and software engineering and product development, primarily in early stage design, development, requirements and specification definition, cost estimating as well as ongoing support for the Clearpath project teams. This will range from answering early stage technical questions in collaboration with our sales team, to technology investigations, system architecting, developing concepts for integrated multi-robot systems, drafting product requirements and functional specification documents for new products, to presenting concepts and proposals to potential customers.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Project scope definition in collaboration with our sales team and prospective clients
  • Concept development, cost development, risk assessments, and proposal writing
  • Providing support to our sales team on calls and meetings with potential clients, including some travel to customer sites for discovery and presentation of proposals
  • Sourcing major components from existing and new suppliers
  • Interacting and coordinating our development team as necessary to come up with new ideas
  • Interacting with our project management team to develop project execution plans and schedules
  • Providing guidance as necessary to the project team after design begins

Additional tasks may include:

  • Evaluation of new products and vendors
  • Developing demos with our products and assisting Sales & Marketing in demonstrating Clearpath\'s products and capabilities
  • Investigating new technologies and markets
  • Presenting at tradeshows and seminars
  • Developing early stage prototypes and proof of concepts for new products and
  • Testing new products

About You

You want to work for a technology company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You like being the go-to person for technical questions. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Degree in engineering or a related field, with applicable background
  • Working knowledge in software, controls, mobile robotics, and/or manufacturing processes
  • Experience in pitching a value proposition for a new technology
  • Able to quickly grasp new technical and business problems, able to put self in clients\' shoes
  • Capable of identifying skills and resources required to complete projects which may range from 3-18 months in duration
  • Able to communicate concepts readily through sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to facilitate productive technical team meetings to converge on solution definitions and work plans

Bonus points for:

  • Understanding of the various problems which face robotics adopters (technical and otherwise)
  • Proficiency in using 3D solid modeling for generating concept models
  • Past hands-on experience with mobile robots (hardware and/or software, both is ideal)
  • Project management experience
  • Vehicle design experience
  • Comfortable presenting to small groups wearing expensive suits
  • Past experience participating in development projects that have gone terribly wrong
  • Past experience in "traditional" application engineering and systems commissioning
  • Identifying the grammar mistakes in this job description
  • Ability to diagnose broken equipment by its sounds and smells, or while blindfolded

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Technical Deployment Specialist
item.description:
Description

Position:              Technical Deployment Specialist 
Location:             Kitchener
Experience:        3+ years
Education:          Bachelors in relevant field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The primary objective of the Technical Deployment Specialist (TDS) role is to act as the technical point of contact for a project during the deployment phase. Reporting to the Manager of the Project Management Office (PMO), the Technical Deployment Specialist works closely with the assigned Project Manager (PM) to ensure the technical deployment of a project goes as smoothly as possible. The Technical Deployment Specialist tracks and resolves technical issues and acts as Tier 1 support for both the Systems Engineer and the Project Manager assigned to the project. The Technical Deployment Specialist is the technical bridge/universal translator between the Project Manager and the OTTO Motors Engineering team.

Responsibilities of the Technical Deployment Specialist include:
  • Supplement the project ‘voice of the customer’ at the technical level.
  • Work with the Project Managers and Systems Engineers to plan and deploy projects after receiving a PO and leading up to and including a Site Acceptance Test.
  • Gain a broad exposure to all aspects of the OTTO Motors technology and interact effectively with varied departments.
  • Gain a working knowledge of the processes and workflows of the PMO and those of other OTTO Motors teams.
  • Have a familiarity with and understand the principal functions of all information systems used at OTTO Motors: Epicor, Jira, Salesforce, Elastic/Kibana, Wiki, Google Suite, OTTO Motors Knowledge Base, Arena/PLM.
  • Understand the basics of: AMR SW, AMR HW, Infrastructure (Fleet Manager SW, IT policies, Networking), Product capabilities/limitations, and best practices for all current and recent past products.
  • Troubleshoot issues with any of the aforementioned topics quickly and effectively, escalating in a timely manner when an issue requires a solution from a SME.
  • Assist with robot diagnostic data collection and primary triage for root cause analysis or escalation to Tier III or Tier IV support.
  • Reduce the number of \'direct-to-engineering\' escalations arising from on-site issues; this lets the developers focus on new features without getting distracted by minor issues.
  • Collaborate with OTTO Motors Engineering to troubleshoot project issues.
  • Pre-configure Fleet Manager OVA\'s (installation files) for deployment at customer sites and assist with issues arising during the installation process.
  • Act as primary IT/network SME on active deployments and assigned upgrades.
  • Keep track of the state of multiple project assignments at any given time, and maintain information records for each, from kickoff to handoff.
  • Self-prioritize workloads, often when under multiple \'crisis\' situations at customer sites.
  • Communicate effectively with SMEs, other OTTO Motors employees (of varying levels of technical expertise) and with the customer.
  • Translating high-level technical concepts into easy-to-understand terms.
  • Prepare technical documentation about each deployment to facilitate the transition from the deployment phase to the support phase.
  • Understand the product capabilities and limitations and explain the context of each to different parties, including internal to OTTO Motors.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

Required skills:

  • Previous experience in a technical customer facing role
  • College diploma in engineering or other technical field
  • Excellent organizational skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritize and analyze difficult issues
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced high mix low volume environment
  • Ability to work unsupervised while still effectively achieving goals
  • Strong technical aptitude and ability to learn new skills and tools
  • Background or exposure to an industrial automation environment
  • Proven ability to work cooperatively with others in a team environment
  • Technical writing/communication

 
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Software Product Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:             Senior Software Product Manager

Location:            Kitchener, Ontario

Experience:        5+ Years of relevant work experience

Education:          Undergraduate degree (Business, Engineering, CS, Surprise us!)

Division:              OTTO Motors

About Us

Clearpath provides self-driving vehicle technology and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s industrial and research divisions: OTTO Motors and Clearpath Robotics.

OTTO Motors designs, manufactures and operates self-driving vehicles for busy factories and warehouses. You’ll find an empowering environment where job titles don’t matter, people leave their egos at the door, everyone works really hard to get things done and we tackle hard problems head-on. We employ passionate and highly talented professionals who are looking to push the envelope and help us achieve our ultimate goal: to put an OTTO in every factory in the world.

 

About the Opportunity:

We are looking for a senior software product manager to add to our growing team. We need someone with a track record of success bringing great products to market. An ideal candidate has experience bringing enterprise-grade software to market, comes from an automation background or really understands the industrial automation, manufacturing, or distribution space.

 

You will be responsible for a critical part of our portfolio in material movement and your experience in product management will help you drive the products’ success. You will work closely with the rest of the OTTO product development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. You will work closely with both sales and marketing to ensure your products are competitive, valuable and understood in the marketplace.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to product strategy, vision, and execution of our software to ensure the health, well-being and happiness of our robots.
  • Build a detailed near- and long-term product roadmap. Validate with key customers and stakeholders.
  • Translate software requirements into product deliverables and drive them to completion
  • Work closely with the engineering team to deliver great software solutions
  • Act as a product evangelist internally and externally champion the best in class material movement platform
  • Be the expert on the competition and how to beat them.

Required Experience/Skills:

Product Managers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world. That being said we consider these baselines for our next team member:

  • You have been building software products for a while and have 5+ years’ experience shipping products as a product manager
  • You have a degree or diploma in Business or Engineering related fields
  • You have worked with engineering teams as a product owner and have demonstrable experience leading cross-functional teams to define, execute and iterate on projects
  • You are adept at both verbal and visual communication and can lead teams through difficult decisions.
  • You have a demonstrable track record shipping high-quality product, and can excel in product design when required
  • You can break down strategy into tactics and tactics into metrics

What’s in it for you:

  • Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision
  • Work-life balance (flexible hours)
  • Competitive compensation
  • Health benefits
  • Career development
  • Equity 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: General Manager, Managed Services
item.description:
Description

Position:           General Manager,  Managed Services
Location:          Kitchener, Ontario or Remote        
Experience:       5+ yrs relevant work experience
Education:        Diploma/Degree in a related field 
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We relate our success directly to our ability to help clients reliably achieve their materials management requirements. To continue operating at our high standards, we’re seeking an experienced general manager to join us and help lead our robots as a managed services. As an ideal candidate, you’ll be a born leader with previous managerial experience. You’ll have proven experience overseeing operations focused on client success, with strong aptitude in human resources, finance, and vendor management. You’re an expert communicator with a strong ability to delegate responsibilities and collaborate across a wide range of departments. Ultimately, you’re driven by the desire to lead a team toward client success and maximum productivity and efficiency.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Develop strategic plans for optimized productivity and ensure we execute profitably on current and future managed services projects.
  • Review and improve organizational effectiveness by developing processes, overseeing employees, establishing a highly motivated work environment, and creating innovative approaches for improvement.
  • Execute on existing and future managed services engagements to the highest standards of excellence and soaring quality.
  • Seek out opportunities for expansion and growth by developing new business relationships.
  • Provide guidance and feedback to help others strengthen specific knowledge/skill areas.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Oversee day-to-day operations of our managed services, assigning weekly performance goals and assuring their completion, while accomplishing your own goals
  • Recruit, onboard, and train high-performing employees to achieve profitability, client success, and business plan objectives
  • Maintain project timelines to ensure tasks are accomplished on time
  • Develop, implement, and maintain budgetary and resource allocation plans
  • Delegate responsibilities to the best employees to perform them while enforcing all policies, procedures, standards, specifications, guidelines, training programs, and cultural values
  • Resolve internal staff conflicts efficiently and to the mutual benefit of those involved

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. 

Required Skills:

  • Proven experience in a managerial role
  • Strong decision-making capabilities
  • Fanatically passionate about Client Success and helping them achieve their business goals 
  • Above-average communication, collaboration, and delegation skills
  • Proven ability to develop and achieve financial plans
  • Ability to motivate and lead people, and hold employees accountable
  • Strong working knowledge of manufacturing industry and processes

Bonus points for:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field
  • Previous performance evaluation experience in relation to Service Level Agreements
  • Current Professional Engineer designation

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:            Senior Systems Engineer
Location:           South-Western Ontario           
Experience:       8+ years of relevant work experience
Education:         College Diploma / University Degree in an Engineering Discipline
Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • understanding customer requirements and ensuring clarity of all requirements prior to proceeding with the detailed design;
  • consulting with applications engineering during the requirements and concept definition process; documenting/updating the requirements when needed
  • detailed design & integration of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes design of the workflow as well as the communications required from our system to any third party automation systems in the facility where the system is being installed
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above

Additional responsibilities include:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~30 - 40 % travel commitment (NOTE: No travel outside of North America currently with the COVID-19 travel restrictions)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

As an experienced Systems Engineer you believe that the final product is more than the sum of its component parts and live in this area of optimising the intersection of the components. You are no stranger to the intricacies of engineering compromise and the need to consider all aspects of the whole when crafting the ultimate fulfillment of the system requirements. Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end user systematically.

Required background:

  • 8+ years of relevant work experience
  • 5+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users

Required skills:

  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail
  • familiarity of working with Linux
  • ability to navigate through and program PLCs
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics

Bonus for experience:

  • data analysis experience
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other
  • experience with inductive automation ignition OPC/UA software

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.
