item.title: Systems Engineering Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:            Systems Engineering Manager
Location:           South-Western Ontario           
Experience:       5+ years of relevant work experience
Education:         College Diploma / University Degree in an Engineering Discipline
Division:             OTTO Motors

 About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will lead and manage a Systems Engineering (SE) team that focuses on enabling OTTO’s integration partners to successfully design and deploy fleets of OTTO Motors autonomous mobile robots. In addition, the team you manage will regularly do the design and integration work directly.  As a manager, you will be providing tactical day-to-day guidance, direction, and coaching; establishing team strategy (objectives, metrics, priorities, and best practices); enabling the team to perform at their best, as well as applying your technical expertise to solve complex problems.  

In addition to deploying and assisting partners to deploy OTTO systems, the SE team creates, implements, and analyses use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

You will be responsible for:

  • ensuring consistent quality of service and deliverables from the systems engineering group,
  • successful achievement of the SE department goals, including revenue attainment
  • adapting and improving the overall SE service and performance,
  • workload balancing and capacity planning,
  • enabling your team to excel in fulfilling their responsibilities,
  • managing the group budget, and
  • scaling team and providing performance and development feedback.

Additional responsibilities include:

  • strengthening the SE working relationships with the rest of the organization,
  • being a trusted SE representative for major account activities (customer presentations, account planning, etc.),
  • tools and process development and implementation, 
  • building, consolidating (i.e. organizing) and leveraging the SE (and broader) knowledge base, and
  • backfilling for unavailable team members.

Required skills:

  • good planner (e.g. capacity planning, work planning, project planning)
  • good listener (i.e. open to receiving feedback and implementing improvements accordingly)
  • a keen eye for detail (e.g. reviewer/editor of SE designs and deliverables)
  • strong facilitator (e.g. team improvement initiatives, solution decision making, etc.)
  • good negotiator (e.g. resolving priority conflicts, managing ‘extra’ resource demands, etc.)
  • effective decision making (e.g. helping to resolve design and/or implementation challenges for projects)
  • good communicator (e.g. editor of SE written communications, customer interactions, reporting on SE team performance, investment pitches, etc.)
  • visionary (contributing to growth strategy, such as integrator enablement, proactive system design investments, strategies for working with ‘key’ accounts, etc.)
  • technical acuity (e.g. ideas contributor to implementation strategies, product features requirements, advanced toolkit, etc.)
  • System design skills (technical writing, diagram creation, system analysis (via simulation), etc.)
  • able to recognize talent (recruiting) and the need for improvement

Required Background:

  • 5+ years of experience as a direct contributor role performing industrial automation design and/or integration
  • 2+ years of experience as a manager/leader of a technical team of five or more people
  • Demonstrated ability to quickly grasp new technical and business problems related to manufacturing, inventory management, distribution and order fulfillment, etc.
  • Previous recruitment experience, with the ability to identify and select, and develop talented individuals
  • Experienced customer-facing communicator
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada, and travel to the USA, at time of application

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integration Engineer - Autonomous Robotics
item.description:
Description

Position:              Systems Integration Engineer - Autonomous Robotics       
Location:             USA - Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky, Illinois     
Experience:        3-8 years of relevant work experience (IC3 Intermediate)
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment (NOTE: No travel outside of the USA currently with the COVID-19 travel

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • Required skills:
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:            Systems Integrator
Location:           USA -  Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky, Illinois          
Experience:       4+ years of relevant work experience
Education:         College Diploma / University Degree in an Engineering Discipline
Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and creates, implements, and analyses use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

You will be responsible for:

  • understanding customer requirements and ensuring clarity of all requirements prior to proceeding with the detailed design;
  • consulting with applications engineering during the requirements and concept definition process;
  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes design of the workflow as well as the communications required from our system to any third party automation systems in the facility where the system is being installed
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above.

Additional responsibilities include:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • sharing your insights, knowledge, and lessons learned;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment (NOTE: No travel outside of the USA currently with the COVID-19 travel restrictions)

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.  You want to have your hands on the system of AMRs, supplemental automation equipment, and travel to customer sites to integrate AMR solutions within their facilities.

As a Systems Integration Engineer you believe that the final system is more than the sum of its component parts and live in this area of optimising the intersection of the components. You are no stranger to the intricacies of engineering compromise and the need to consider all aspects of the whole when crafting the ultimate fulfillment of the system requirements. Your mastery in systems integration comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end user systematically.

Required background:

  • 4+ years of relevant work experience
  • 4+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems

Required skills:

  • comfortable navigating through and programming PLCs
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized
  • a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • lean manufacturing education
  • data analysis experience
  • working with Atlassian Confluence products
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position:          Account Executive 
Location:          Remote - North America
Experience:      5 + Years’ experience selling technical products, preferably material handling solutions
Division:          OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is automating the world and we need your help.  Got what it takes?

We’re looking for a passionate, self-driven, and motivated Account Executive (AEx) to join our OTTO Motors Sales Organization. We strive to become the ‘renaissance people’ of deal-making, with proven skills across all account functions: strategic account planning, business development, direct technical sales, and account administration. This is a remote position, with 50% travel required – you will receive support from the team regardless of location.

You will:

  • Pursue target accounts in your territory, infiltrate those accounts at the highest decision-making level, and secure that business.
  • Devise account strategies that leverage OTTO solutions and go-to-market strategy to expand OTTO within target accounts
  • Develop business relationships across the organization elevating Clearpath’s position within the executive ranks. 
  • Work with clients to identify materials handling automation opportunities in their facilities, promote and demonstrate the OTTO solution and engage the customers in projects with compelling business cases.    
  • Be responsible for pipeline growth and revenue growth in your territory.
  • Devise your personal strategy to systematically conquer your slice of the globe... and we will do everything we can to support you along the way!  
  • The AEx reports directly to the Director of Sales. You will be paid a base salary plus commissions and benefits.

Ideal Sales Characteristics:

Our next AEx is a sharp, articulate and persuasive person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to highly-technical Production Engineers, Facility Directors and VP and C Level Executives.

  • Coachability – ability to understand feedback and change behavior
  • Curiosity – ability and desire to ask probing questions
  • Prior Success – based on previous sales results and/or ambition
  • Intelligence – ability to become a subject matter expert
  • Emotional Intelligence – self-awareness, self-management, social awareness and relationship building with others 
  • Passion – brings an intense enthusiasm to the team
  • Work Ethic – willingness to put in the extra effort to succeed
  • Preparation – technical aptitude of product and market/buyer understanding
  • Competitiveness – a drive to succeed that enables higher performance
  • Adaptability - ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Culture Fit – fit with company core values and culture

Required Skills and Experience: 

  • University degree in a STEM, Business or related field
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant industry experience in a variety of technical roles including Applications Engineering, Project/Program Management and Technical Sales
  • Proven success in Business Development, Direct Sales and/or Key Account Management
  • Experience selling to mid market and enterprise organizations
  • Experience with CRM products such as Salesforce.com is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects, customers, and partners.
  • Strategic thinker who is also hands-on to get results
  • Ability to travel to customers 25-50% of the time.

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Applications Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:            Applications Engineer
Location:            Kitchener, Ontario or Remote/Virtual Canada
Experience:        3+ years
Education:          Graduate degree in engineering or a related field
Division:             OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of software and hardware that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will work as a member of the OTTO Motors’ sales organization in an applications technical role as a partner to our account executives.  You will be accountable for understanding customer requirements, selecting the best products, and devising solutions that ultimately improve our customer’s business and that meet or exceed the application requirements.  You will also consult with channel partners and internal deployment teams to devise deployment plans that achieve the best time-to-value for the end users.  

You will be constantly interacting with customers, learning new technology, developing new system concepts, creating the foundation for successful projects, and impressing clients via virtual and in-person demonstrations of how their business can improve using our products. 

This role requires an awareness and proficiency with systems engineering, industrial engineering, project planning, and it involves interacting with many elements of our business.  

Responsibilities:

  • Be a product knowledge expert, technical consultant, and content creator throughout the sales cycle.
  • Build trust, advise, and demonstrate the value of our products, our brand, and our business for prospective customers and channel partners.
  • Enable deployment teams by supplying solution concepts, preliminary project plans, and budgets.
  • Collect and communicate market data and ideas to our product management organization to improve the market success of our existing and future products.
  • Contribute to department improvement initiatives to enhance the team’s efficiency and the value of its contributions to the business.

Example tasks you may own to fulfill these responsibilities include:

  • Planning and owning actions within account and opportunity capture plans
  • Visiting customer sites and interacting with customers/end-users to understand their needs
  • Analyzing customer data to assess the business impacts and ROI that OTTO solutions can provide
  • Devising system/solution designs, for projects ranging from proof of concept to multi-million dollar deployments
  • Creating preliminary project plans (milestones, risks, etc.) covering the full lifecycle of a project to ensure concepts, budgets, etc. are comprehensive and accurate, and that the project is primed for success. Your ability to foresee potential bumps along the way is a skill.
  • Perform in-house, virtual, and in-field demonstrations of OTTO products
  • Telling a comprehensive product/feature story wherever you recognize gaps in our product roadmap

Required Skills

  • Diploma in technical field or degree in engineering, material handling, robotics, or a related field 
  • Able to quickly grasp new technical and business problems related to manufacturing, inventory management, distribution and order fulfillment, etc.
  • Able to put self in clients\' shoes and understand the value of technology to end user stakeholders
  • Capable of identifying skills and resources required to complete advanced automation projects
  • Experienced customer facing communicator
  • Able to communicate concepts readily through sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to facilitate productive technical team discussions to converge on solution definitions and work plans

Bonus points for

  • Experience working with vehicle automation for indoor industrial applications
  • Experience in pitching a value proposition for a new technology
  • Experience with facilitating group decision making
  • Good presentation skills
  • Understanding the various problems which face robotics adopters (technical and otherwise)
  • Project management experience
  • Past experience learning from development projects that have gone terribly wrong
  • Working knowledge of controls and aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, navigation
  • Working knowledge in software, specifically C++ and/or Python in a Linux environment

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic data engineer who’s excited by the opportunity of designing distributed systems to support applications at the forefront of machine learning technology. As a Data Engineer, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering systems to efficiently acquire, prepare, and process data for state-of-the-art AI solutions that we build at Borealis AI.

 

Engineering plays a vital role at Borealis AI, turning our machine learning models into products that generate exponential business value. We understand the financial system we operate in, and we have the resources, knowledge and tools to improve it. Our team of 40+ engineers work with leading Machine Learning researchers to accelerate, build and deploy products that will enhance risk applications, reduce fraud, help millions of people manage cash flow, access credit and plan for their financial futures. In the finance sector, millions of people are counting on us to get it right.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Design and build data pipelines for Borealis AI projects;
  • Build efficient data systems and abstractions for Borealis AI projects;
  • Collaborating with research, engineering and business teams to model and deliver on their data needs.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent. A master’s or PhD in an AI sub-field is an asset;
  • Strong enterprise experience in designing and building data lakes;
  • Solid understanding of distributed computing frameworks (i.e. Spark, Hadoop) as well as SQL, NoSQL and graph databases;
  • 3+ years of software development experience in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment;
  • Strong experience with writing modular, robust, scalable software in one of the major languages such as C++, Java, Python 3.x;
  • Strong experience with the Unix command line and bash scripting;
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an experienced Dev/Ops Support Engineer who will bring focus and subject-matter expertise around designing, implementing and supporting machine learning infrastructure and automation tools in production. This is a unique opportunity to grow in the world of machine learning infrastructure and work with a team of passionate individuals committed to the mission of bringing ML to enterprise.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Providing production support and maintenance for ML applications;
  • Designing, building, and optimizing machine learning deployment tools and automation systems that operate the business’s data and ML applications;
  • Collaborating with engineers, and machine learning researchers to automate code analysis, build, integration and deployment of ML applications;
  • Supporting applications and projects with infrastructure design decisions, and monitoring solutions;
  • Building highly scalable, resilient cloud and on-premise systems for hosting machine learning systems using state-of-the-art technologies;;
  • Providing after-hours production support.

You\'re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • Strong experience with Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps and production support;
  • Strong and relevant experience supporting and maintaining distributed systems;
  • Hands-on experience building and deploying virtualized environments in major cloud environments, such as Kubernetes, AWS and Azure;
  • Experience with building tools and applications to automate various infrastructure tasks (Jenkins, etc.);
  • Proficiency with programming languages such as Python, Bash, or JavaScript;
  • Experience implementing monitoring solutions to identify system bottlenecks and production issues;
  • Solid understanding of the UNIX operating system.

It would be great if you also have:

  • Knowledge of the machine learning application deployment process;
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including testing methods, coding standards, code reviews and source control management;
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, Theano, and/or similar.

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential;
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable;
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities;
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale.

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: General Application
item.description: Don\'t see a role for you? Please complete the form below to share your interest in Borealis AI!

item.title: Machine Learning Engineering Lead
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our Equities Returns Prediction team, being at the forefront of machine learning technology and working on extremely challenging problems. 

 

As a Machine Learning Engineering Lead, you’ll be responsible for owning and delivering a project end to end – everything from data pre-processing to implementing machine learning training pipelines and deploying inference in a production environment. You’ll be directly managing a team of machine learning engineers, responsible for strategic planning, execution and delivery. You will provide your team with technical leadership and mentorship. You will work along other engineering leads across Borealis AI. As a people manager you will be responsible for growing your team and fostering career growth of the engineers. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Lead and directly manage a team of engineers, being responsible for planning execution and delivery of ML systems; 
  • Establish high standards and share knowledge in performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering best practices; 
  • Establish and maintain collaboration with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions; 
  • Extending prototypes into fully functional, polished solutions ready for internal and/or external use; 
  • Grow and develop the team, helping each team member advance in their career. 

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • Have 7+ years of experience delivering software projects to production; 
  • Have experience managing a team of engineers; 
  • Have experience developing modular, robust, scalable software in a modern programming language; 
  • Experience working with business, product and other technical teams; 
  • Experience with scaling and performance of large systems; 
  • Have led the full lifecycle of software product development including the successful deployment of products to production; 
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software products, fostering career growth of software engineers, and establishing software engineering best practices within your team; 
  • Have background in machine learning or a related field; 
  • Experience with Capital Markets or any financial domain is a big plus. 

What\'s in it for you?

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock options where applicable; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. 

About Borealis AI

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity?

As a Machine Learning Researcher, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. We\'re a lab that supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects. Working in our lab will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to build game-changing statistical models.

 

Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A passion for solving open problems using data and algorithms;
  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications and/or sophisticated AI product experience;
  • Ability to formulate and drive a research project independently without close supervision;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.

What’s in it for you?

item.title: Machine Learning Researcher - Time Series
item.description:
What\'s the Opportunity?

Capital markets are known for their complex dynamics and intricate dependencies. As a Machine Learning Researcher in our capital markets team, you’re looking to channel your love of playing with real-world data into industry-disrupting solutions. Our team supports research on a wide variety of theoretical and applied machine learning projects, including game-changing studies on dynamic interactions between statistical models operating on a common source of data.

 

Working in capital markets will grant you unique access to massive structured and unstructured datasets with the tools and resources necessary to drive your vision. Being part of our team means you’ll also have the opportunity to publish original research in peer-reviewed academic journals and participate in conferences around the world, such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AISTATS and more.

Your responsibilities include:

  • Developing novel AI solutions that facilitate impactful products;
  • Conducting original, publishable research by advancing the state-of-the-art in machine learning techniques;
  • Working with the development team to transfer research work into production;
  • Interpreting larger organizational needs and designing algorithmic solutions that can drive the next generation of banking experiences;
  • Identifying relevant new AI technologies as they become available, and disseminating them into the bank’s technology capabilities.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A PhD in a sub-area of AI or demonstrated research track record by means of publications;
  • A passion for solving open problems in areas such as time-series analysis, generative modelling, graph-based architectures, or multi-agent systems;
  • Proficiency in Python and Deep Learning packages such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.
  • An eye for efficiency and experience with large-scale optimization on large-scale data.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with C++ and network programming.
  • [Bonus] Familiarity with market microstructure, alpha research, or game theory.

item.title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
item.description:
Available Locations
Vancouver

What\'s the opportunity?

We’re looking for an enthusiastic software developer who’s excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of machine learning technology, and working on extremely challenging problems. As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you’ll be part of building, delivering, and improving our diverse set of ML products.

 

At Borealis AI, you’ll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. 

Your responsibilities include:

  • Designing, building, and improving machine learning-based software solutions
  • Collaborating with research and business teams to converge on the best solutions
  • Optimizing algorithms and prototypical solutions for efficient implementation
  • Supporting projects with thorough documentation of usage, design decisions and capabilities

You\'re our ideal candidate if you:

  • 1+ years of software development experience (including co-op and internships) in a high-responsibility, minimal-supervision environment
  • Experience with writing modular and robust software in one of the major languages. Experience in Python is an asset

  • Familiarity with RDBMS and/or NoSQL graph databases

item.title: Technical Recruiter
item.description:
What\'s the opportunity? 

Borealis AI’s mission is to be a leader in AI for financial services and world-class talent is at the heart of this vision.  We are looking for an experienced Technical Recruiter to support our recruitment objectives, including creatively sourcing, managing the candidate lifecycle, and closing candidates.

 

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to gain experience in a cutting-edge industry of AI/ML, who wants to be part of an innovative organization. You will have the opportunity to partner with hiring managers across our labs, working together
to find the best talent to support us in achieving our goals. Our team believes in being Bold & Curious, so we are looking for someone who is creative, eager to learn and looking to make an impact!

Your responsibilities include:

  • Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy; 
  • Using a variety of techniques to discover and attract the best passive talent; 
  • Conducting interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline, as well as skills to be successful in the Borealis AI environment; 
  • Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity; 
  • Constantly evaluating our processes and pipeline to ensure we are fairly evaluating candidates;   
  • Ensure the ATS (Greenhouse) and recruitment reporting is regularly updated to aid with metrics i.e. sources, agency against direct, time to hire, time to offer, average cost per hire, etc; 
  • Drive specific D&I activity/initiatives for recruiting by upskilling hiring managers on best practice and ensuring data is tracked successfully.

You’re our ideal candidate if you have: 

  • Minimum of 2+ years of technical recruiting experience; 
  • Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing technical talent; 
  • Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and internal stakeholders, helping them navigate the sources of talent, and assisting them with assessment; 
  • Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation, and employment market trends; 
  • The ability to lead requisitions to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality; 
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills; 
  • A genuine interest in the technology industry as shown by continuous learning throughout your career; 
  • Experience in a start-up, fast-paced environment;   
  • Experience with engineering, research and product roles would be a benefit. 

What’s in it for you? 

  • Become part of a team that thinks progressively and works collaboratively. We care about seeing each other reach full potential; 
  • Freedom to take initiative; 
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities; 
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact from a local-to-global scale. 

About Borealis

Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto,Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.  

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment 

RBC is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected factors. item.title: Data Analyst Lead (People Analytics, Canada, Remote)
item.description:
About the role

Responsibilities:

  • Build and help grow a diverse team of analysts that are highly aligned, curious, passionate about Shopify’s talent and the business, and impactful

  • Apply data visualization principles, SQL, and the right BI tool (Mode, Google Data Studio) to improve our reporting layer, leading by example

  • Build a roadmap of support to provide key stakeholder teams with dashboards that provide the data and insights they need to empower and unlock their roles

  • Lead discussions and decisions with stakeholder teams around the right metrics/KPIs to monitor and surface

  • Communicate, educate and influence stakeholder teams on how they can best use data to improve their programs

  • Manage and prioritize ad-hoc requests, identify the right opportunities to inform our roadmap, and improve the process around receiving and executing on requests

  • Define and advance best practices for how to best collaborate with external analyst teams and how to partner with People Analytics

Qualifications

 

  • Strong SQL, able to lead by example in implementation (PostgreSQL, BigQuery)

  • Experience with BI tools (Mode, Google Data Studio)

  • Leading/building teams analysts or equivalent technical/analytical roles

  • Stakeholder management (prioritization, setting expectations, problem scoping and solving)

  • Data storytelling; communicates the constraints/considerations of the data, makes clear recommendations

  • Communication skills (clear, succinct, approachable)

  • A passion/curiosity for the people/talent data domain

  • Analytical and systems mindset

  • Pragmatic problem solver

 

Nice-to-have’s:

  • Product analytics

  • Python

  • Git

  • ETL/data systems

  • Partnering with data scientists/engineers

This job will be closed on March 30, 2022 or sooner if we see high volume of applicants.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role.

item.title: Data Development Manager (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Platform Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security and quality of our datasets.

  • The Analytics group leverages the Engine primitives to build and deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  

  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams on Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency as they champion reliability across the platform.

Your role:

  • Providing people and technical leadership within your team to support the mission of the Data Platform Engineering group. 

  • Working closely with a cross-functional team of product leaders, engineering leaders, and distributed system engineers to influence the organizational vision and help solve hard problems in scaling the data platform.

  • Strategic and tactical deliverables for your team.

  • Deploying the team towards data platform priorities, achieving measurable impact and outcomes.

  • Defining and executing on your team’s deliverables.

  • Sourcing and hiring for positions in your team or organization.

  • All aspects of performance management, including compensation, performance improvement plans, promotions, and separations.

Qualifications

About You:

  • An experienced manager of teams of high-performing engineers.

  • Technical engineering background in one or more areas listed in the next section.

  • A proven track record of delivering impactful results.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.

A Data Development Manager at Shopify would typically have at least 2 years of experience leading high-functioning teams, and expertise in one or more of the following areas:

  • Experience with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)

  • Experience in query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
    Experience with security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)

  • Experience deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)

  • Experience building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)

  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)

  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)

#LI-REMOTE

Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere

item.title: Data Science Manager (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

We are looking for Data Science Managers to join our Data Science teams and help shape the insights and algorithms that will inform our strategies as we grow globally.  

What your role will look like:

  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other RnD stakeholders to guide their decisions using data

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. experimental design, recommender systems and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build  models, tables or schemas that support business processes

  • Empower teams to build and maintain actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

 

Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • 7-10 years of commercial experience as in a data science role solving high impact business problems, including 3+ years leading and maintaining high performance data science teams
  • Experience building and managing high performance data science teams
  • Experience delivering business impact through analysis and data products
  • Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
  • Technical leadership and management experience (you enjoy doing both).  You can jump into the code to the level that your direct reports admire and respect, but are also interested in developing people and capacity for your team
  • Experience creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
  • Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike

It would be great if you have:

  • Previous experience using Spark (either via Scala or Pyspark)
  • Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis, shipping productionized machine learning systems or other advanced techniques are also welcome
  • Experience with data storytelling using Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, D3, or similar data visualization tools

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - SHOP (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

We\'re looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team as we turn Shop into one of the most beloved products and brands in the world. We want shoppers to be able to develop meaningful connections with the brands they love, and we believe that Shop is the answer to helping foster those relationships with the powerhouse of Shopify merchants we love and support.

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

Our Data Scientists focus on pushing products and the business forward, with a focus on solving important problems rather than specific tools. We are looking for talented data scientists to help us better understand our merchants and buyers so we can help them on their journey.

Your responsibilities:

  • Proactively identify and champion projects that solve complex problems across multiple domains

  • Partner closely with product, engineering and other business leaders to influence product and program decisions with data

  • Apply specialized skills and fundamental data science methods (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed) to inform improvements to our business

  • Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines: work closely with stakeholders to build instrumentation and define dimensional models, tables or schemas  that support business processes

  • Build actionable KPIs, production-quality dashboards, informative deep dives, and scalable data products

  • Influence leadership to drive more data-informed decisions

  • Define and advance best practices within data science and product teams

 

Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • 4-6 years of commercial experience as a Data Scientist ​​​​​​solving high impact business problems

  • Extensive experience with Python and software engineering fundamentals

  • Experience with applied statistics and quantitative modelling (e.g. regression, survival analysis, segmentation, experimentation, and machine learning when needed)

  • Demonstrated ability to translate analytical insights into clear recommendations and effectively communicate them to technical and non-technical stakeholders

  • Curiosity about the problem domain and an analytical approach

  • Strong sense of ownership and growth mindset

It would be nice if you have:

  • Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques

  • Expertise with statistical techniques and their applications in business

  • Masterful data storytelling and strategic thinking

  • Deep understanding of dimensional modelling and scaling ETL pipelines

  • Experience launching productionized machine learning models at scale

  • Extensive domain experience in e-commerce, marketing or SaaS

 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We know that looking for a new role can be both exciting and time-consuming, and we truly appreciate your effort.  We want to know what you\'re really interested in building and why you want to build it at Shop, so please give us as much detail on this as you\'d like in the answers on the next page. 👍 📖

#LI-REMOTE 

Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere

Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.

At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

How we hire

At Shopify, we put a lot of care and time into who we hire. We believe that in order to build the best products, we need to build high impact teams. Our recruitment process centres around what we call the Life Story interview, a conversational-style interview where we get to learn more about you.

item.title: Staff (Lead) Data Scientist (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Data is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. 

Our Staff (i.e Lead) Data Scientists focus on pushing products and the business forward, with a focus on solving important problems rather than specific tools. We are looking for talented data scientists to help us better understand our merchants and buyers so we can help them on their journey.

Qualifications

  • 7-10 years of commercial experience in a data science role solving high impact business problems
  • You have well built technical experience that inspires individual contributors  creativity and innovation. 
  • You have experience with product leadership and technical decision making.
  • You have been working closely with various levels of business stakeholders, from c-suite and down.
  • You can jump into the code on a deep level, but are also able to contribute to long term initiatives by mentoring your team.
  • Multiple work streams excites you, you are able to use ambiguity as an opportunity for high level thinking.
  • Experience creating data product strategies, data products, iterating after launch, and trying again.
  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals

What would be great if you have:

  • Previous experience using Spark.
  • Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis.
  • Exposure to Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, or similar data visualization tools.

 

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role.

item.title: Staff (Lead) Data Engineer (Remote, Canada)
item.description:
About the role

Our Data Platform Engineering group builds and maintains the platform that delivers accessible data to power decision-making at Shopify for millions of merchants. We’re hiring high-impact developers across teams:

  • The Engine group organizes all merchant and Shopify data into our data lake in highly-optimized formats for fast query processing, and maintaining the security and quality of our datasets.

  • The Analytics group leverages the Engine primitives to build and deliver simple and useful products that power scalable transformation of data at Shopify in batch, streaming, or for machine learning. This group is focused on making it really simple for our users to answer three questions: What happened in the past? What is happening now? And, what will happen in the future?  

  • The Data Experiences group builds end-user experiences for experimentation, data discovery, and business intelligence reporting.

  • The Reliability group operates the data platform in a consistent and reliable manner. They build tools for other teams on Data Platform to leverage and encourage consistency as they champion reliability across the platform.

Qualifications

  • An experienced technical leader with a proven track record of delivering impactful results.

  • Technical engineering background in one or more areas in the next section.

  • Experience with technical mentoring, coaching, and improving the technical output of the people around you.

  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand language for our stakeholders. 

  • Excitement for working with a remote team; you value collaborating on problems, asking questions, delivering feedback, and supporting others in their goals whether they are in your vicinity or entire cities apart.

A Staff (Lead) Data Engineer would typically have 6-10 years of experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Experience with the internals of a distributed compute engine (Spark, Presto, DBT, or Flink/Beam)

  • Experience in query optimization, resource allocation and management, and data lake performance (Presto, SQL)

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Terraform)
    Experience with security products and methods (Apache Ranger, Apache Knox, OAuth, IAM, Kerberos)

  • Experience deploying and scaling ML solutions using open-source frameworks (MLFlow, TFX, H2O, etc.)

  • Experience building full-stack applications (Ruby/Rails, React, TypeScript)

  • Background and practical experience in statistics and/or computational mathematics (Bayesian and Frequentist approaches, NumPy, PyMC3, etc.)

  • Modern Big-Data storage technologies (Iceberg, Hudi, Delta)

#LI-REMOTE 

Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere
